long_desc.thetext: One question: What is "aspects.Aop" and why does it show up as a requirement for qx.Class?

Hi All,
I noticed something interesting about this bug. If you go into:
-qx.ui.window.Desktop -qx.ui.window.MDesktop
And modify lines 44 and 77 respectively to instantiate the window manager using
'new qx.ui.window.Manager()'
Instead of
'new qx.ui.window.Window.DEFAULT_MANAGER_CLASS()'
The problem goes away. It pops up again in another place in my app and it's the same situation. See line 161 of qx.ui.table.columnmodel.Basic
... = new qx.ui.table.columnmodel.Basic.DEFAULT_HEADER_RENDERER());
It seems that instantiating classes using a variable for the class name doesn't play nicely with the Aspect library.
I hope this information helps, I'd love to be able to use the profiler. Don't hesitate to get in touch if I can be of any assistance. If I get time I will try and write a fix for this. I don't have enough knowledge of the aspect library at the moment though.
Cheers, Nick T
